claim: User 1465’s highest-FavoriteCount voted post is id 3.

reasoning: User 1465 voted on 3 posts (IDs: 6, 181, 2328). The one with the highest FavoriteCount is post 6 (FavoriteCount=137), not post 3. User 1465 did not even vote on post 3.

content.text: The claim says "User 1465's highest-FavoriteCount voted post is id 3." I need to parse this carefully. The claim is about the post voted by user 1465 that has the highest FavoriteCount. Let me find posts that user 1465 voted on, then check which one has the highest FavoriteCount.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/codebase_community.sqlite" "SELECT v.PostId, p.FavoriteCount FROM votes v JOIN posts p ON v.PostId = p.Id WHERE v.UserId = 1465 ORDER BY p.FavoriteCount DESC LIMIT 10;"
input.description: Find posts voted by user 1465 ordered by FavoriteCount

content.text:
The post voted by user 1465 with the highest FavoriteCount is post **6** (FavoriteCount = 137), not post **3**.

Let me also check if post 3 was even voted on by user 1465:

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/codebase_community.sqlite" "SELECT * FROM votes WHERE UserId = 1465 AND PostId = 3;"
input.description: Check if user 1465 voted on post 3

content.text:
User 1465 didn't even vote on post 3. The post voted by user 1465 with the highest FavoriteCount is post 6 (with FavoriteCount = 137), not post 3.
